greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is number of partitions of n having at least k distinct parts (n >= 1, k >= 1).
comment: Row n has length A003056(n) hence the first element of column k is in row A000217(k).
[0, 0] together with column 2 gives A144300. - _Omar E. Pol_, Sep 17 2016
reference: Jacques Barbot, Essai sur la structuration de l'analyse combinatoire, Paris, Dulac, 1973, Annexe 12A, p. 74.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..500, flattened
formula: T(n,k) = Sum_{j>=k} A116608(n,j) assuming A116608(n,j)=0 when j>A003056(n).
mathematica: Table[DeleteCases[Map[Count[Map[Length@ Union@ # &, IntegerPartitions@ n], k_ /; k >= #] &, Range@ n], 0], {n, 19}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 14 2016 *)
results.author: _Michel Marcus_, Aug 24 2015
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 24 2015
